original_title: Sri Lanka bond yields open higher, rupee at 319.30/60 against the US dollar
original_body_lines: ECONOMYNEXT – Sri Lanka’s bond yields opened higher on Thursday, while the rupee opened at 319.30/60 against the US dollar in the spot market, dealers said.
A bond maturing on 01.07.2025 was quoted at 29.60/30.00 percent up from 29.00/75 percent at the last close.
A bond maturing on 01.05.2027 was quoted at 27.70/90 percent, up from 27.50/70 percent.
The rupee opened at 319.30/90 against the US dollar in the spot market appreciated from the last close at 319.80/95. (Colombo/May04/2023)
